tasks.description: German language classroom scene with two students meeting for the first time. Anna (woman, mid-20s) and Tom (man, mid-20s) are standing near desks, smiling and introducing themselves to each other. Casual, friendly atmosphere. Other students visible in background. Whiteboard with 'Deutsch A1' written on it.

tasks.notes: Characters should appear friendly and approachable to encourage learners

tasks.description: Formal business meeting scene. Herr Schmidt (man in business suit, 40s) and Frau Ahmadi (woman in professional attire with headscarf, 30s) are shaking hands in a modern office. Both are standing, maintaining professional distance. Conference room visible in background.
tasks.context: Dialog: Formal introduction using 'Guten Tag', 'Sie', and professional titles (Herr/Frau)

specs.style: professional office environment, business formal dress code, respectful atmosphere

tasks.notes: Should contrast with the informal classroom scene to highlight du vs Sie difference

tasks.description: Educational diagram showing conjugation of verb 'sein' (to be). Clean table format with three rows: 'ich bin' (I am), 'du bist' (you are informal), 'Sie sind' (you are formal). Use color coding: blue for ich, green for du, red for Sie. Include simple stick figures or icons for each pronoun.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Conjugation of irregular verb 'sein' - most important German verb

specs.style: educational diagram, clean typography, color-coded sections, easy to memorize

tasks.notes: Should be clear enough for students to use as study reference

tasks.description: Educational diagram showing conjugation of verb 'heißen' (to be called). Table format with three rows: 'ich heiße' (my name is), 'du heißt' (your name is), 'Sie heißen' (your name is formal). Include example names: Maria, Tom, Herr Müller. Highlight the ß character.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Conjugation of verb 'heißen' - used for introducing yourself

specs.style: educational diagram, clear typography, highlight special characters (ß)

tasks.notes: Emphasize the ß character as it's unique to German

tasks.description: Cultural comparison infographic: 'Du vs Sie'. Split image showing two scenarios. Left side (Du): young people, casual clothes, friends at cafe, labeled 'informal'. Right side (Sie): business people, formal attire, office setting, labeled 'formal'. Include visual cues: Du with lowercase 'd', Sie with capital 'S'. Add icons for appropriate contexts: family/friends for du, work/strangers for Sie.
tasks.context: Cultural note: When to use informal 'du' vs formal 'Sie' in German society

specs.style: infographic style, split comparison, clear visual distinction, culturally accurate

tasks.notes: Critical cultural concept - should be immediately clear and memorable

tasks.description: German classroom scene. Anna approaches Tom with a smile. Dialog: 'Hallo! Ich bin Anna. Wie heißt du?' - Tom: 'Hallo Anna! Ich heiße Tom.' - Anna: 'Freut mich, Tom!' - Tom: 'Freut mich auch!' Natural body language, friendly gestures, maintain eye contact.
tasks.context: Complete informal introduction dialog demonstrating greeting and name exchange

specs.audio: Clear German pronunciation, friendly tone, natural pace

tasks.notes: Actors should use natural gestures for greetings. Emphasize clear pronunciation for beginners.

tasks.description: Professional office setting. Herr Schmidt and Frau Ahmadi meet formally. Dialog: Schmidt: 'Guten Tag! Mein Name ist Schmidt. Wie heißen Sie?' - Ahmadi: 'Guten Tag, Herr Schmidt.
